question: At 2015, your vessel is at the Chesapeake Bay Bridge and Tunnel midway between buoys "13" and "14".  If the height of tide is -1 foot (-0.3 meters), what is the approximate depth of water?
If you steer 143°pgc from your 2015 position at an engine speed of 8.0 knots, at what time would you reach a point midway between buoys "11" and "12" (ignore set and drift)?
At 2015, you alter course to 154°pgc.  What is the course per standard magnetic compass (psc)?

options: Only deep-draft passenger ships and large naval vessels may use the main channel.
A tow drawing 20 feet is excluded from the main channel.
The channel is 14.5 miles in length.
Thimble Shoal Channel is in international waters.
question: Which of the following concerning Thimble Shoal Channel is TRUE?

At 2118, you obtain the following bearings:

Cape Henry Light -    148°pgc
Cape Charles Light -  033°pgc
Thimble Shoal Light - 291°pgc

From this position, you proceed to Norfolk, VA, a distance of approximately 26.0 miles.  To arrive at Norfolk by 0200 the next day, what is the speed to make good from your 2118 position to arrive at this time?
What is your 2118 position?
If the Old Point Comfort main light was inoperative what emergency light would be shown?

You are on course 192°pgc at 12 knots.  You obtain a loran fix at 1900 using the following information:

 9960-X-27120
 9960-Y-41623
 9960-Z-58729

 What is your latitude and longitude at 1900?
What course should you steer using the standard magnetic compass (psc) to make good the course of 192°pgc?
At 1920, the buoy off your starboard bow is __________.
At 1930, your position is LAT 37°16.7'N, LONG 75°37.7'W. The depth of water is approximately __________.
At 1950, your position is LAT 37°12.3'N, LONG 75°38.6'W. The set and drift from 1930 to 1950 were __________.

At 2020, you obtain a fix using the following information:
 9960-X-27112
 9960-Y-41432

 Cape Charles Lighted Bell Buoy "14" bears 333°pgc.  Your longitude is __________.

If you make good 12 knots, what is the ETA at North Chesapeake Channel Entrance Buoy "NCA" (LL #375)?
At 2100, Cape Charles Light bears 321°pgc, and Cape Henry Light bears 247°pgc.  Your latitude is __________.

options: The light has never been visible.
question: If the visibility is 3 miles, at what range will you lose sight of Chesapeake Light?

options: an area with local magnetic disturbances
a precautionary area centered on buoy "CBJ"
question: At 2100, you alter course to 250°T and reduce speed to 7 knots.  You enter the traffic separation scheme on the inbound side.  At 2200, your fix shows you crossing a broken purple line on the chart, and you observe North Chesapeake Entrance Lighted Gong Buoy "NCD" to port.  This area is __________.
What course per standard magnetic compass is (psc) the same as 247°pgc?

At 2215, Cape Henry Light bears 242°pgc, Cape Charles Light bears 010.5°pgc, and Chesapeake Channel Tunnel North Light bears 319°pgc.  You are heading 271°pgc.  What is the relative bearing of Thimble Shoal Light?

options: navigate in the main channel when between Trestles A & B
remain 1500 yards (1360 meters) from large naval vessels
maintain a speed of six knots
question: While navigating inbound Thimble Shoal Channel system you must __________.
Your 1600 position is LAT 37°22.5'N, LONG 75°32.3'W.  The depth of water under the keel is about __________.
If there is no current, what is the course per gyro compass from your 1600 position to point A located 0.5 mile due east of Hog Island Lighted Bell Buoy "12"?
At 1630, you reach point A and come right to 204°T.  Your engine speed is 12 knots.  Your 1715, position is LAT 37°09.8'N, LONG 75°37.4'W.  The current was __________.

From your 1715 fix, you steer 214°T at 12 knots.  At 1800,
you take a fix using the following Loran-C readings:

 9960 - X - 27116.8
 9960 - Y - 41386.0
 9960 - Z - 58620.6

Your 1800 position is __________.

From your 1815 position, you want to make good a course of 263°T.  Your engines are turning RPM's for 12 knots.  The current is 050°T at 1.9 knots.  Adjusting your course for set and drift, at what time should you expect to enter the red sector of Cape Henry Light?
At 1920, Cape Henry Light bears 225°pgc, and Chesapeake Channel Tunnel North Light bears 288°pgc.  If your heading is 268°T, what is the relative bearing of Chesapeake Light?

options: You are governed by the Inland Rules of the Road.
You are entering a restricted area.
You are within the Chesapeake Bay Entrance traffic separation scheme.
You can expect differences of as much as 6° from the normal magnetic variation of the area.
question: Which statement concerning your 1920 position is TRUE?
From your 1920 position, you change course to enter Chesapeake Channel between buoys 9 and 10.  What is the course per standard magnetic compass (psc) ?

At 2000, your position is LAT 37°04.1'N, LONG 76°05.6'W. You change course for the Eastern Shore.  At 2037, Old Plantation Flats Light bears 033°pgc, and York Spit Light bears 282°pgc.  The course made good from your 2000 position is __________.

At 2037, you change course to make good a course of 016°T.  There is no current, but a westerly wind is causing  3° leeway.  What course per standard magnetic compass (psc) should you steer to make good the course 016°T?
Your height of eye is 25 feet (7.6 meters).  If the visibility is 5.5 nautical miles, what is the luminous range of Wolf Trap Light?
If you want a more detailed chart of the area at your 2115 DR position, which chart should you use?
At 2123, your position is LAT 37°20.0'N, LONG 76°03.0'W. What is your distance offshore of Savage Neck?
From your 2123 position, you are approximately 42 miles from Crisfield, MD.  If you are making good a speed of 13 knots, at what time should you arrive at Crisfield, MD?
The National Weather Service provides 24 hour weather broadcasts to vessels transiting the Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel area on which frequency?
At 1752, your position is LAT 37°04.3'N, LONG 76°06.4'W. On a flood current you should expect to be set to the __________.

options: less than 0.5 mile eastward of York Spit Channel
less than 0.5 mile westward of York Spit Channel
greater than 0.5 mile westward of York Spit Channel
greater than 0.5 mile eastward of York Spit Channel
question: Your 1752 position places you __________.
What is the average velocity of the maximum flood current at the Tail of the Horseshoe?

From your 1752 position, you steer 307°pgc at 9 knots.  At 1805, you obtain the visual bearings.  What are the latitude and longitude of your 1805 position?  Old Pt. Comfort Light 232°pgc. Chesapeake Bay Tunnel North Light 130°pgc.

options: the side of York Spit Channel
the visibility limit of the red sector of Cape Henry Light
the end of York Spit Channel
the junction of the York Spit and York River Entrance Channels
question: At 1810, you sight a buoy on your starboard side labeled "19".  This buoy marks __________.

 9960-X-27252.0
 9960-Y-41432.0
 9960-Z-58537.5

Your latitude is __________.

What was the speed made good from 1845 to 1930?
What is the height above water of Davis Creek Channel Light "1"?
If you have 17.3 miles to reach your destination from your 2000 position and want to be there at 2230, what speed should you make good?

What is the maximum allowable speed of vessels underway up river from Tue Marshes Light?
At 1750, your position is LAT 37°14.5'N, LONG 76°22.9'W. What was the course made good between 1730 and 1750?
At 1800, Tue Marshes Light bears 264.5°pgc, York Spit Swash Channel Light "3" bears 007°pgc.  Your position is __________.
What course should you steer per standard magnetic compass in order to navigate down the center of York River Entrance Channel (ignore set and drift)?

You have just passed York River Entrance Channel Lighted Buoys "13" and "14".  The chart shows a light approximately 1.0 mile off your port beam with a light characteristic "Fl 6 sec".  What is the name of this light?

At 1930, your vessel is between York River Entrance Channel Lighted Buoys "1YR" and "2".  From this position, you change course to 142°pgc at an engine speed of 8.0 knots. At 2001, you obtain the following information: 

Chesapeake Channel Tunnel North Light - 131°pgc; Thimble Shoal Light -                                  248°pgc  

What were the set and drift between 1930 and 2001?

At 1400, your position is LAT 37°14.7'N, LONG 76°22.3'W. From this position, you head for the York River Entrance Channel Buoy "17".  What should you steer per standard magnetic compass for this heading?

options: the piloting channel for Mobjack Bay
question: At 1430, your position is LAT 37°12.8'N, LONG 76°17.7'W. At this time, you come left and steer 045°T.  This course will lead you through a channel bordered by yellow buoys. The dashed magenta lines between the buoys mark __________.
From your 1430 fix, you order turns for 8 knots.  You steer 045°T and experience no set and drift.  At what time would you expect to have New Point Comfort Spit Light "4" abeam?

From your 1830 fix, you continue south on a course of 150°T turning RPMs for 6 knots.  You encounter a flood current in the direction of 330°T at 2 knots.  Adjusting your course for set and drift, which course would you steer to make good a course of 150°T while turning RPMs for 6 knots?

Determine your 1915 position using the following information obtained at 1915.  
          Visual bearings 
Cape Charles Light 107°pgc
Cape Henry Light   172°pgc 
 
          Radar Bearing and Range 
Chesapeake Channel Tunnel South Light  189°pgc at 7.2 miles

From your 1915 fix you come right and steer a course of 200°T.  At 2000, your position is LAT 37°05.5'N, LONG 76°07.0'W.  Your intention is to pass through Chesapeake Channel.  If there are no set and drift, what course would you steer per standard magnetic compass to make good a course of 145°T?

At 2100, you have passed through the Chesapeake Bay Bridge and Tunnel and determine your position to be LAT 37°01.3'N, LONG 76°03.0'W.  The current is flooding in a direction of 303°T at 2.5 knots.  Adjusting your course for set and drift, which course would you steer while turning RPMs for 6 knots to make good a course of 175°T?

options: the Cape Henry Light red sector
question: At 2150, your position is LAT 36°57.2'N, LONG 76°01.3'W. In this position on the chart, you note a light magenta line running in a direction of 030°T.  This line indicates the limits of __________.

At 2200, you are in position LAT 36°57.5'N, LONG 76°02.5'W.  You intend to travel up the Thimble Shoals auxiliary Channel to Hampton Roads. According to the Coast Pilot, what is the depth of the auxiliary channel on either side of the main channel?

From your 2200 fix, you steer course 288°T to travel up the Thimble Shoal North Auxiliary Channel.  If you are making good 6.0 knots, at what time would you expect to pass buoy "18" at the west end of the channel?  (There are no set and drift.)

At 2205, you are in Thimble Shoal North Auxiliary Channel abeam of lighted gong buoy "4".  At this time the visibility decreases to 5 miles.  You continue to turn RPMs for 6 knots and experience no set and drift.  What time would you expect Old Point Comfort Light (white sector) to become visible?
The mean high water level at Old Point Comfort is __________.
You are entering Norfolk Harbor and have just passed Craney Island.  Which chart should you use for your final approach into Norfolk Harbor?

options: The depth of the water in your vicinity is about 38 to 40 fathoms (69.1 meters to 72.7 meters).
The closest major aid to navigation is  New Point Comfort.
You are less than a mile from a sunken wreck which could interfere with your tow.
You will pass through a disposal area on your present course.
question: Your 0200 position is LAT 37°23.5'N, LONG 76°09.2'W. Your speed is 8 knots, and your course is 095°T.  Which statement is TRUE?

At 0315, you obtain the following loran readings:

 9960-Y-41588.0
 9960-X-27240.0

What is the true course from this position to the entrance of York Spit Channel?
From your 0315 position, what time can you expect to reach York Spit Channel Buoys "37" and "38"?

Which chart could you use for greater detail of the area at the south end of York Spit Channel?

You leave York Spit Channel at buoy "14" at 0600 with an engine speed of 12 knots.  You receive orders to rendezvous with the tug "Quicksilver" and her tow at Hog Island Bell Buoy "12".  What is your ETA at the rendezvous point, if you pass through Chesapeake Channel to buoy "CBJ", through the outbound traffic separation lane to buoy "NCA" (LL#375), and then to the rendezvous point?

You arrive at the rendezvous point, secure the tow, and head back southward.  At 1200, you take the following loran readings:

 9960-Y-41534
 9960-X-27114
 9960-Z-58691

What is your 1200 position?

Your gyro and electronic gear are again operating.  At 1710, Chesapeake Light bears 137°pgc at 6.6 miles.  The current is setting 160°T at 2 knots.  At your speed of 6 knots, what is your true course to steer to remain in the inbound traffic lane?

At 1810, you obtain the following loran readings:

 9960-X-27158.0
 9960-Y-41292.5
 9960-Z-58546.9

What is your position?
What speed have you made good from 1710 to 1810?
If you make good a speed of 6.0 knots from your 1810 position, what is your ETA at Chesapeake Channel Lighted Bell Buoy "2C"?

options: sandy hills about eighty feet high
low and thinly wooded with many beach houses
question: The coastline by Cape Henry is best described as __________.

options: change after you reach Chesapeake Channel Lighted Bell Buoy "2C"
change before you reach Chesapeake Channel Lighted Bell Buoy "2C"

New Point Comfort Light "2"           242°T  
Wolf Trap Light                               313°T  
Horn Harbor Entrance Light "HH"  262°T  

What is your 0410 position?
If the visibility is 5 miles and you are in the red sector, at what distance off should you sight Cape Henry Light?
From your 0410 fix, what is the course per standard magnetic compass to the entrance to York Spit Channel between buoys "37" and "38"?

You are turning for 9 knots, a westerly wind is causing 3°
of leeway, and the current is 320°T at 1.2 knots.  What true course should you steer to remain in the northern leg of York Spit Channel?
If you are making 8.3 knots over the ground, what is your ETA at the first turning point in York Spit Channel between buoys "29" and "30"?

options: Chesapeake Bay Harbor- master's Regulations Manual
question: Which publication contains the specific information about navigating in York Spit Channel?

What is the course per gyrocompass?

options: Thimble Shoal Main Channel or the South Auxiliary Channel
Any of the channels but keep to the right hand side

 9960-X-27224

Further information on how far you must remain from the carrier found is in __________.

options: The South Auxiliary Channel or Thimble Shoal Channel, but you must remain on the right hand side of the channel.
The South Auxiliary Channel since your draft is less than 25 feet (7.6 meters) and you are not a passenger vessel.
The North Auxiliary Channel since you are going to turn to a northerly heading near buoy "12".
